topic.title: Adding a Data Disk to the Object Storage Daemon (OSD) Nodes
topic.abstract: Steps for adding additional data disks to your OSD nodes.If you want to add additional data disks to your existing OSD nodes, these steps will show you how to.

section.title: Adding a Data Disk to an Object Storage Daemon (OSD) Node
section.p: Prior to beginning these steps, ensure that there are no pre-existing partitions on the data disk that you will be adding.

ol.li: Log in to the lifecycle manager.

Edit the ~/helion/my_cloud/definition/data/disks_osd.yml file and enter the details for the new data disk.
Example: - name: ceph-osd-data-and-journal devices: - name: /dev/sdn consumer: name: ceph attrs: usage: data journal_disk: /dev/sdj The journal_disk in the above example is optional and if is isn't provided then a partition on the data disk will be consumed for journalling.
Commit the configuration changes to git: cd ~/helion/hos/ansible git add -A git commit -m "Adding new OSD data disk"
Run the configuration processor: cd ~/helion/hos/ansible ansible-playbook -i hosts/localhost config-processor-run.yml
Create the deployment directory: cd ~/helion/hos/ansible ansible-playbook -i hosts/localhost ready-deployment.yml
Redeploy Ceph with this playbook: cd ~/scratch/ansible/next/hos/ansible ansible-playbook -i hosts/verb_hosts ceph-deploy.yml
